question: Two years ago, around the same time I hit menopause, I began having BIG problems with heat intolerance.  My internist didn't seem to get it.  Kept asking me when I got these flashes.  I tried to explain, NOT flashes.  All the time and last long time.  Different from night sweats and face flushing.  Put me on .1mg estradiol which did help menopause symptoms and 10 mcg daily of cytomel but still I could not wear a sweater in winter, or long sleeves or anything but light weight material.  Heavy sweating all year round. People around me are freezing and I have a fan directed straight at me on top of a/c.  Recently referred to endo and she took me off cytomel and put me on 50 mcg a day of synthyroid and ran all kinds of tests. In five months I gained 50 lbs., walked like an old lady (I am 55) back pain, elbow and hip pain, etc.  Tests came back T-4 was 4 and was diagnosed with Hashimoto thyroiditis. On synthroid 2 months but no improvement.  She then took more tests and doubled my hormone which I am not crazy about.  I now wear two weekly .1 mg patches to get .2 mg.  No improvement from the heat intolerance and sweating. This time the additional tests showed marked vitamin D deficiency.  25-OH D3 was 12 and D2 was <4. So, it says 12L.  Now just put on 50,000 units ergocalciferol to take once a week on top of all the other meds. Just started taking that.  I guess it could it explain the joint pain.  GTT tests showed normal so no diabetes though an elevated fasting glucose of 108.Thing is, I just don't match up to any pigeon hole. Hypothyroidism I should be feeling cold all the time, and the hyperthyroiditis has the heat intolerance.  Oh, and my PTH is 31.5 and CA 10.3 so that's okay.  Recent bone density test shows more than fine.  Everything over 100.  Average was 117.  I am just so tired of sweating all the time and being so over-heated.  Also, the fatigue has gotten much worse and the lower back and joint pain has made it very hard to get back to the gym.  The weight gain so fast has freaked everyone and I hate to go anywhere.  I went from a size 10 to a size 20 in clothes.  Help!
title: Endo's Diagnoses Confusing
